lead_paragraph: Mr. Obama implored both sides to avoid inflammatory words and actions as protests against police shootings ramped up across the country over the weekend.

byline.contributor: Mark Landler reported from Madrid, and Nicholas Fandos from Washington.
byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and NICHOLAS FANDOS

headline.print_headline: Obama Urges Mutual Respect From Protesters and Police in Race Debate
headline.main: President Obama Urges Mutual Respect From Protesters and Police

snippet: Mr. Obama implored both sides to avoid inflammatory words and actions as protests against police shootings ramped up across the country over the weekend....
abstract: Pres Obama, speaking on last day of trip to Spain and Poland, urges calm debate and discorse between Americans rather than escalation of tensions between law enforcement and public brought on by week's tragic events.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dallas, Tex, Shooting of Police Officers (2016)
